programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: Country music icon, Trace Adkins, hosts INSP's first competition show, Ultimate Cowboy Showdown. Twelve real working cowboys from all walks of life lock horns for a prize that could change their lives. As the contestants get settled in on a cattle ranch, friendships form and tensions rise between them. Things heat up between two of the competitors when a cowboy feels disrespected. In the first challenge, the cowboys are split up into two teams where they must sort their own team's cattle out of a mixed herd. Trace welcomes two expert cattlemen to help judge their performances. In the end, Trace sends two contestants packing, leaving only ten cowboys standing.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: While out on a run delivering a top-secret message, Cody encounters a wounded mountain man who wants him to care for his pet bear. Meanwhile, in Sweetwater, the other riders care for an abandoned baby.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: U.S. Marshal Sam Buckhart escorts an Indian prisoner back east to stand trial. They arrive in North Fork and Lucas finds out that Buckhart is also an Indian who was educated at Harvard. Angry townspeople try to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Julia Andueza opens a boarding house in North Fork. Lucas remembers her as a dishonest card dealer from the past. Her old boss arrives and tries to bully Julia into turning her business into a gambling house. Lucas realizes she has changed her ways.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas' life is in danger after he agrees to testify in a murder case in another town. The only other witness was killed, and when a gun-toting stranger appears at the McCain Ranch, Lucas now finds himself in grave danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Outlaw Sam Morley, an old friend, comes to the McCain Ranch. He asks Lucas to turn in him for the $500 reward and use the money to pay for his girlfriend's medical care. However, a bounty hunter has other ideas.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne joins in the search for a missing 10-year-old boy along with the help of a Sioux boy named Char. While the boy finds himself trapped by a cave-in, the locals find his horse nearby and suspect the Sioux took him.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne finds a wounded man in Mexico and takes him to a doctor in a local village. Once he arrives, he learns that a dangerous bandit is there to avenge two of his men's deaths by destroying the village.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: When an infection threatens the herd, Bubba, Cody and Booger have to act fast. They enlist the help of young veterinary student Dakota to doctor the cows and keep the virus from spreading. Cody helps Misty take the first step towards starting her cattle business. The cowboys decide to build an office for the company, but Bubba throws a wrench into the plan when he's called to Mississippi to visit Kaley's parents. Bubba's in-laws pressure him to take a hard look at his future while Booger works up the nerve to pop the question and start a future with Jaclyn.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: A routine job turns tough when the cowboys struggle to wrangle the herd across a highway, sparking Cody's idea to use GPS devices so they can easily find cattle in the pasture. Bubba hides a cow in the woods and Booger challenges Cody to prove GPS technology beats traditional methods. Misty and Kaley help Jaclyn find the perfect wedding dress while Bubba fails to fit into his tuxedo pants, prompting Booger and Cody to put him on a weight-loss regimen. Cody writes a song in honor of Booger's wedding and surprises Misty with a trailer for her new cattle business.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While escorting a killer named Stanley to North Fork to stand trial, Lucas and Marshal Micah Torrance endure harsh conditions crossing the desert. Micah is injured and their horses are lost. The prisoner taunts them but Lucas' endurance prevails.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A dying friend of Lucas McCain's asks him to go to a nearby town to bring back his wife, Elizabeth, so he can see her one last time. Lucas agrees but is surprised to find a beautiful, young actress who is not interested in grieving over her husband.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: A young Jim Bridger helps a Shoshone woman escape the clutches of her abusive husband. As Bridger squares off against the frontier ruffian and his henchmen, he soon realizes that the woman he is helping is none other than the legendary Sacajawea.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: When a young girl is bitten by a rattlesnake, mountain man Jim Bridger finds himself in a race against time to save her arm and keep her alive as he desperately searches the wilderness for a medicinal plant that once saved the life of his friend.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: Now without a badge, former lawman Bat Masterson finds himself powerless to help an old friend whose brother has been falsely imprisoned. An overreaching sheriff is intent on seeing the brother hang, so Bat hatches a plan to bust him out of jail.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.sub-title: Al Jennings and the Legend of Dick West
programme.desc: Tired of his boring life, attorney Al Jennings dreams of the adventures he reads in dime novels. After a chance encounter with Dick West, Jennings joins the outlaw's gang and learns that a life of crime isn't as glamorous as he thought it would be.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: When frontiersman James Harrod founds Harrod's Town on Native American hunting grounds in Kentucky, he soon finds his new settlement under attack. His leadership is tested as he defends the first European settlement west of the Appalachian Mountains.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: World champion tie-down roper, Fred Whitfield, joins Trace Adkins to judge the cowboys as they compete in an individual calf-roping challenge. The contestant who ropes the fastest time wins immunity from the next elimination. Tensions continue to build between two of the competitors until one reaches his breaking point, and things get physical. A team challenge puts the cowboys' skills to the test. Trace wonders if some of them have the experience needed to compete at this level. The two contestants who fall short hit the trail, leaving eight cowboys remaining.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: There is a new girl in Sweetwater, and she has eyes for Buck. However, Buck must contend with her rich, oppressive father. Meanwhile, the riders help a woman in need after the corrupt banker's henchmen kill her husband.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Tom Birch, an old childhood friend, comes to visit Lucas unexpectedly. Birch promises he is just passing through on his way to Denver. But Lucas soon finds out about a plot to rob the North Fork Bank and must choose between friendship and justice.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Just released from prison, Dan Maury comes to North Fork in search of Marshal Micah Torrance, who helped get him locked up. Torrance carries a shotgun everywhere he goes, but Maury plans to wait him out.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A crooked marshal comes to North Fork looking for a wanted man. He finds a man fitting the futitive's description. He deliberately kills the wrong man to collect the bounty and then blackmails the real outlaw, who wants to keep his past hidden.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An escaped killer wants to prove he hasn't lost his nerve when he holds up North Fork's General Store and takes Marshal Micah Torrance hostage. He provokes the town to try to face him, but only Lucas is strong enough to rise up to his challenge.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne goes on the hunt for his partner when he doesn't return from a private business trip. He leaves to hunt for him and learns that he is wounded and in jail. Later, Cheyenne deals with an estate and lawyer.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: With his friend, Jim O'Neil's hanging scheduled for the next day, Cheyenne visits him in Texas. Jim refuses to tell Cheyenne any details, but Cheyenne uncovers the missing clue that prevents his innocent friend's hanging.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: When an infection threatens the herd, Bubba, Cody and Booger have to act fast. They enlist the help of young veterinary student Dakota to doctor the cows and keep the virus from spreading. Cody helps Misty take the first step towards starting her cattle business. The cowboys decide to build an office for the company, but Bubba throws a wrench into the plan when he's called to Mississippi to visit Kaley's parents. Bubba's in-laws pressure him to take a hard look at his future while Booger works up the nerve to pop the question and start a future with Jaclyn.
